body_content.explanation: Gram-positive bacteria belong to a group of bacteria that cause particular diseases. They have a thick cell wall and can be recognized because they remain purple after being treated with a particular stain (= a chemical that changes the colour of something):
examples: Staphylococcus is part of the Gram-positive group of bacteria.
Bacteria are generally either gram-positive or gram-negative, depending on the colour they turn when they are stained with a special dye.
